column2: COVID-19 negative certification not required / not known As of 30 June 2022, pre arrival testing is no longer required to enter the Cayman Islands.
column3:
Quarantine requirement at government designated site. Seven (7) days of quarantine on arrival are required for unvaccinated travellers (age 12 years and over) with close ties to the Cayman Islands along with all unvaccinated members of their household. Unvaccinated Caymanians, Residents and Work Permit Holders do not need to quarantine on arrival. Vaccinated household members of unvaccinated travellers are not required to quarantine but will be required to undergo daily LFT for 7 days if they wish to leave the premises. GPS tracking is required for all travellers and their companions age 10 years and over who are approved to quarantine at a private residence.
Unvaccinated children aged 11 and younger who are travelling with fully vaccinated adults are also not required to quarantine on arrival in the Cayman Islands.
Transit passengers staying overnight in the Cayman Islands are subject to quarantine, if unvaccinated. Transit passengers are not allowed to quarantine at a private residence.
column4: Find out if you qualify as fully vaccinated in the Cayman Islands on the Cayman Islands Government website. Proof of vaccination status: You must present proof that you have been fully vaccinated to enter the Cayman Islands.
column5:
Latest News:

Internations Restrictions:
*All travellers: All travellers are required to apply on the Travel Cayman Portal and be issued with a travel certificate to enter or travel through the Cayman Islands. Unvaccinated tourist visitors aged 12 and over, who do not have close ties to the Cayman Islands, are not permitted to travel to the Cayman Islands. For more specific information on who can travel to the Cayman Islands consult the Cayman Islands Government website before travelling. The airports in the Cayman Islands are now open with regular scheduled services operating to various locations. As of 30 June 2022, pre arrival testing is no longer required to enter the Cayman Islands.
Cruise passengers disembarking must have completed an approved vaccine course at least 14 days prior to embarking the cruise ship. Unvaccinated children under the age of 12 can only disembark when accompanied by a fully vaccinated adult. Updates will be posted on Cayman Islands Government website. Cargo flights, couriers and air ambulance services continue to operate as usual.
Travel helplines are available to offer advice and assistance to those with an urgent or compassionate need to travel:
In the Cayman Islands, call +1 345 743 8463 or email travelcayman@gov.ky or you can submit your details via the website. *If you’re fully vaccinated: Vaccinated travellers are required to apply to Travel Cayman for a travel certificate at least 72 hours prior to departing for the islands. This does not apply to cruise passengers. Vaccinated travellers can enter the Cayman Islands without needing to quarantine.
Unvaccinated children aged 11 and younger who are travelling with fully vaccinated adults are also not required to quarantine on arrival in the Cayman Islands.
The travel eligibility date must be at least 14 days after you have obtained a complete course of an approved vaccine. Find out if you qualify as fully vaccinated in the Cayman Islands on the Cayman Islands Government website. Proof of vaccination status: You must present proof that you have been fully vaccinated to enter the Cayman Islands. The Cayman Islands will accept the proof of COVID-19 vaccination record and proof of COVID-19 vaccination issued. Your final vaccine dose must have been administered at least 14 days prior to travel. Your appointment card from vaccination centres is not designed to be used as proof of vaccination and should not be used to demonstrate your vaccine status.
*If you’re not fully vaccinated: Unvaccinated tourist visitors aged 12 and over who do not have close ties to the Cayman Islands are not permitted to travel to the Cayman Islands.
Unvaccinated Caymanians, Residents, Work Permit Holders and unvaccinated visitors with close ties to the Cayman Islands are required to apply for to Travel Cayman for a travel certificate 5 days prior to departing for the islands to be able to enter or travel through the Cayman Islands.
Seven (7) days of quarantine on arrival are required for unvaccinated travellers (age 12 years and over) with close ties to the Cayman Islands along with all unvaccinated members of their household. Unvaccinated Caymanians, Residents and Work Permit Holders do not need to quarantine on arrival. Vaccinated household members of unvaccinated travellers are not required to quarantine but will be required to undergo daily LFT for 7 days if they wish to leave the premises. GPS tracking is required for all travellers and their companions age 10 years and over who are approved to quarantine at a private residence.
Find out if you qualify as fully vaccinated in the Cayman Islands on the Cayman Islands Government website. If you’ve had COVID-19 in the past year: If you’re not fully vaccinated but have tested positive for COVID-19 in the last year you can enter the Cayman Islands, but you will be required to quarantine for 7 days in line with the requirements for unvaccinated travellers. Proof of COVID-19 recovery is not accepted in place of full vaccination in the Cayman Islands.
*Children and young people:
• All children age 12 years and over are required to be vaccinated to be exempt from quarantine.
• Unvaccinated children aged 12 years and over, who do not have close ties to the Cayman Islands, are not permitted to travel to the Cayman Islands.
• Unvaccinated visitors and persons with close ties to the island who are aged 11 years and under will need to apply to Travel Cayman for a travel certificate which is required for entry
• Unvaccinated children under the aged 11 years and under will assume the vaccination status of their adult travel companions. If travelling unaccompanied, unvaccinated children residing with persons (ages 12 and older) who are unvaccinated, are required to complete a mandatory quarantine period of 7 days.
*If you’re transiting through the Cayman Islands: Transiting is when you pass through one country on the way to your final destination.
You will need to apply on the Travel Cayman Portal and be issued with a travel certificate to transit through the Cayman Islands. For more specific information on who can travel to the Cayman Islands consult the Cayman Islands Government website for further information before travelling.
Transit passengers staying overnight in the Cayman Islands are subject to quarantine, if unvaccinated. Transit passengers are not allowed to quarantine at a private residence. All in-transit travellers will be required to pay for accommodations at the government-approved facility (Sunshine Suites). Transit passengers must use authorised transport when travelling in-between the airport and the government-approved facility.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in the Cayman Islands: Inter-island flights between Grand Cayman, Cayman Brac and Little Cayman are operating:
• vaccinated travellers are not required to provide a negative result from a PCR or antigen-detecting rapid diagnostic test (lateral flow test)
• unvaccinated travellers age 5 and over must provide a negative result from a PCR or antigen-detecting rapid diagnostic test (lateral flow test) taken no earlier than the day before departure when travelling to or in-between the Cayman Islands
• travellers under the age of 5 are not required to undergo testing
*Public spaces and services: The following restrictions are in place:
• Group gatherings are limited to 1000 outdoors and 500 indoors, with some exemptions
• Masks are compulsory on public transport, including taxis
• Masks must be worn in indoor public places, where 6 feet distance cannot be maintained
• Social distancing of at least 6 feet must be maintained in all public places, unless people are from the same household
• Gyms, fitness centres and other indoor fitness areas now operate without restriction but must observe social distancing regulations ie each person in the property shall maintain a distance of six feet from every other person
• Those renting any shared scuba or snorkelling equipment must register with the Department of Environmental Health
• The use of a hookah, shisha or water pipe is not permitted in places of business
• There are also restrictions for visiting health care facilities, residential home care facilities, and detention centres
For further information, check the Cayman Islands Government website. You can find full details about the restrictions, including exemptions, from the Cayman Islands Government. Any breach of the regulations will be subject to a CI$10,000 fine or two years imprisonment or both.
Workplaces are generally open and employees are undertaking regular lateral flow testing. Educational facilities are open but may be impacted where there are cases of coronavirus detected. Leisure facilities and businesses such as restaurants, bars, gyms, spas, swimming pools are open, but subject to the aforementioned restrictions. Public transport is also operating.
